instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD: What is SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD? SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a pre-requisite for SYS_PWROK_R and PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK..
definitions.PM_S0_PGOOD: What is PM_S0_PGOOD?  PM_S0_PGOOD is created when CPUVR_PGOOD and ALL_SYS_PWRGD are present and branches off to become PM_PCH_PWROK. PM_S0_PGOOD and SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD are necessary to create SYS_PWROK_R and PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK .
definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Missing <SIGNAL>SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Board seems to have been touched by idiots before but I can't find any solder marks, only heat around the CPU (but nothing is melted so I assume it was below 200C)

System has <SIGNAL>PM_S0_PGOOD</SIGNAL> but is missing <SIGNAL>SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD</SIGNAL> and thus does not boot.

<SIGNAL>SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is not shorted to ground

Other then messed up SMC, what could this be? Any clues?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Missing <SIGNAL>SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Uhm, are all rails coming on besides CPU Vcore?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Missing <SIGNAL>SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Overlooked <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4SW_SNS</SIGNAL> which is not being created because <SIGNAL>SMC_SENSOR_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is low. Its also not shorted to ground which still makes this an SMC issue.
I've never seen this issue before, any idea why the SMC is keeping <SIGNAL>SMC_SENSOR_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> low?

I have Vcore by the way, otherwise there woudn't be <SIGNAL>PM_S0_PGOOD</SIGNAL> on this board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Missing <SIGNAL>SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
threads.message: It could be anything, it just means the CPU is not talking to the SMC to release the PGOOD signals. Bad ROM, SMC, CPU, RAM, one stupid missing resistor or cap, something like that.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Missing <SIGNAL>SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hi Smiba,

I got <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board same issue. I got the cpuvcore,no fan spining coz  no <SIGNAL>PM_PCH_SYS_PWROK</SIGNAL> as <SIGNAL>SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is missing. I replaced the SMC still the same. Did you solve this? or any idea? 
THank you.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Missing <SIGNAL>SMC_DELAYED_PWRGD</SIGNAL>
threads.message: No thread hijacking! Make a new thread and give more info.
